gov.usgs.anss.edge

Class RawDisk

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.io.RandomAccessFile
      • gov.usgs.anss.edge.RawDisk
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.io.DataInput, java.io.DataOutput, java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class RawDisk
extends java.io.RandomAccessFile
    This class present a block oriented read/write for the RandomAccessFile class. It basically adds methods which insure read/write on 512 byte boundaries

      • RawDisk

        public RawDisk(java.lang.String file,
       java.lang.String md)
        throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Creates a new instance of RawDisk
        Parameters:
        file - - the filename or full path name to the file
        md - Mode of open "r", "rw", "rws" or "rwd" - rwd is recommended
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - If now a "w", then file was not found for reading.

      • writeBlock

        public void writeBlock(int iblk,
              byte[] b,
              int off,
              int len)
                throws java.io.IOException
        Write len bytes from b at offset off at block iblk
        Parameters:
        iblk - Block to start write at
        b - data buffer
        off - offset in data buffer
        len - length of write
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If seek or write fails.

      • readBlock

        public byte[] readBlock(int iblk,
               int len)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        read starting at blk for len and return as a buffer. Uses readFully so the entire length must be returned.
        Parameters:
        iblk - the block to start the read
        len - the length of the read
        Returns:
        byte array with data - length is fully read so its always len long.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If seek or read fails.

      • readBlock

        public int readBlock(byte[] b,
            int iblk,
            int len)
              throws java.io.IOException
        read starting at blk for len and return as a buffer. Uses readFully so the entire length must be returned.
        Parameters:
        b - A buffer to put the data in.
        iblk - the block to start the read
        len - the length of the read
        Returns:
        len if data were read, should block if not
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If seek or read fails.

        args - command line args
